title: Bats in the Attic
subtle: Personal Recount (fiction), 1,755 words, Level T (Grade 3), Lexile 660L
description: Bats in the Attic, written in the first person, recounts a child's summer vacation at the shore with Gram. Living in a Victorian beach town is quite a contrast to the child's usual life in the city. The child learns the importance of bats, how to dig and cook clams, and to say good-bye to a very special summer. This book is the final installment in a three-part series about a child's summer at the shore.
